document_data.name: Battle Song
document_data.mainbody: '''''Battle song''''' was a [[Divine magic|divine]] [[conjuration]] [[spell]] used by priests devoted to [[Milil]], enabling them to boost the fighting spirit of their allies.
document_data.Effects: This spell created a loud ringing song that boosted the combat skills of anyone within a {{SIAdj|50|ft|long=yes}} cube of the caster. ''Battle song'' only affected those present when the spell was cast. This spell could be prevented from being cast by hindering the caster's vocal abilities.
document_data.Components: This spell required only [[verbal]] and [[somatic]] components to cast.
document_data.History: In the month of [[Eleasis]], of the {{YearlinkName|1371}}, [[Chief Prelate]] [[Relarn Dayspring|Dayspring]] of the [[Clerical Circle]] of [[Ravens Bluff]] declared it illegal for priests to cast ''battle song'' within city limits due to a raging unnatural storm at the time called the [[Soulstorm]], threatening arrest for those that broke this decree.{{Cite trumpeter/2-8|2}}{{LCRB}}
